original: The endorsement by Auriemma of Berkshire is of commercial value.

original: c) “FINANCIAL SERVICES ” shall mean banking, lending, financial and wealth management products and services offered by Berkshire and insurance products and services offered by Berkshire ’s affiliate Berkshire Insurance Group, Inc.
ollama_generated: d) "FINANCIAL SERVICES" shall now encompass all banking, lending, financial, wealth management products and services provided by Berkshire, as well as insurance products and services offered not only by Berkshire's affiliate Berkshire Insurance Group, Inc., but also by any third-party providers that Berkshire may engage with in the course of providing such services. This expanded definition implies that clients may encounter services rendered by entities other than Berkshire or its named affiliate for certain financial and insurance products or services.

original: g) “BERKSHIRE COMPETITOR ” is any person or entity that in any way competes with Berkshire ’s financial services.
ollama_generated: h) "Competing Entities to Berkshire" shall refer to any individual, organization, or business entity whose activities in the financial services sector may potentially overlap or be perceived as a challenge to Berkshire's market position, regardless of the extent or nature of such competition.

original: i) “$” shall mean the lawful currency of the United States of America unless otherwise specified.
ollama_generated: i) "USD" shall refer to the U.S. Dollar, except in instances where a different currency is explicitly stipulated.

original: c) The License Rights are exclusive to Berkshire and may not be assigned or in any way conveyed by Berkshire without Auriemma ’s express written consent, except in the event of a merger by Berkshire with another entity offering Banking Services.
modified: d) Auriemma retains the right to transfer or assign the License Rights at their discretion, subject to Berkshire's prior written approval, which shall not be unreasonably withheld. Any assignment or conveyance by Auriemma will not require Berkshire's consent if such action is made in connection with a merger or acquisition where Berkshire is merged with another entity that provides Banking Services.

original: Upon the breach of either of the above conditions, the non -defaulting party may terminate this Agreement as follows: (A) as to a default under clause (i) above, if payment is not made within ten (10) days after the defaulting party shall have received written notice of such failure to make payment; or (B) as to a default under clause (ii) above, if such default is not cured within thirty (30) days after the defaulting party shall have received written notice specifying in reasonable detail the nature of such default and such action the defaulting party must take in order to cure each such item of default.
ollama_generated: Upon the occurrence of either of the aforementioned conditions, the party not in breach may choose to discontinue this Agreement under the following circumstances: (A) for a non-payment issue arising from clause (i) above, if the defaulting party fails to rectify the situation within ten (10) days following receipt of written notice outlining the overdue payment; or (B) in case of a violation under clause (ii) above, if the defaulting party does not remedy the situation within thirty (30) days of receiving written notification detailing the nature of the breach and the required corrective actions. The onus will be on the defaulting party to demonstrate that they have taken appropriate steps to rectify the default.

12. ALTERNATIVE RECOURSES AND OPTIONAL RESPONSES.

In the event that a breach of this Agreement occurs, the non-breaching party shall have the discretionary power to pursue alternative remedies, rather than being obligated to do so. Furthermore, the parties acknowledge that the available remedies under this Agreement are optional and not exhaustive; any additional rights or remedies available by law remain unaffected.

original: If any provision(s) of this Agreement shall be determined to be void, ambiguous, or unenforceable, the same shall be stricken from this Agreement and in no way shall affect other provisions of, or the validity or enforceability of this Agreement. The Parties understand that the contents of this Agreement are confidential, and that disclosure of same to any third party could be detrimental to the interests of one or both Parties. Therefore, the Parties agree not to disclose the terms of this Agreement, without the prior written permission of the other party, other than to business advisors, legal and financial representatives, except as required by federal securities laws, or federal or state banking laws.
ollama_generated: In the event that any provision(s) within this Agreement is deemed invalid, vague, or unenforceable, such provision(s) shall be severed from the Agreement and shall not render the remaining provisions, or the overall validity and enforceability of the Agreement, questionable. Both Parties acknowledge and accept that the contents of this Agreement are sensitive and could adversely impact their respective interests if disclosed to external parties. Consequently, they mutually agree to refrain from disclosing the specific terms of this Agreement without the explicit written consent of each other. Exceptions to this confidentiality obligation include sharing with business advisors, legal or financial representatives, as necessary, and compliance with federal securities laws or banking regulations.

original: Accordingly, there shall be no withholding for tax purposes from any payments due Auriemma hereunder and Auriemma shall be responsible for any and all income and other tax payments required by Auriemma. Nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed to place the parties in the relationship of legal representatives, partners or joint ventures. Neither Party shall have any power to bind the other in any manner whatsoever, other than as otherwise stated in this Agreement. This paragraph shall survive termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Consequently, any payments owed to Auriemma under this agreement will not be subject to tax withholding, but it is important to note that Auriemma is solely responsible for all applicable taxes and income-related obligations. This agreement should not be interpreted as creating a legal representative, partnership, or joint venture relationship between the parties. Neither party possesses the authority to commit the other in any capacity beyond what is explicitly stated within this agreement. This provision will remain valid even after termination of this agreement.

modified:
22. TRANSFER OF RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS.

Buyer shall have the right to transfer or assign all its rights and obligations under this Agreement, provided that such transfer does not impair the quality of goods or services or compromise Buyer's ability to fulfill its duties hereunder, and that the assignee agrees in writing to be bound by the terms of this Agreement. In such case, Seller shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon written notice to Buyer.

ollama_generated:
24. NON-APPLICABILITY OF UNENFORCEABLE PROVISIONS.

In the event that any provision or part thereof of this Agreement is deemed invalid, illegal or unenforceable in any jurisdiction, such invalidity, illegality, or unenforceability shall not affect the validity, legality, or enforceability of the remaining provisions of this Agreement in such jurisdiction nor render this Agreement as a whole invalid, illegal or unenforceable. Instead, such provision shall be construed to conform with applicable law as nearly as possible while preserving the original intent and purpose of the parties. If it is impossible to so construe, the parties agree that this Agreement will be deemed amended to exclude such invalid, illegal, or unenforceable provision or part thereof from this Agreement in such jurisdiction, and the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect. In this case, the parties acknowledge that they would have executed this Agreement without including any such invalid, illegal, or unenforceable provision had they foreseen its invalidity, illegality, or unenforceability.

25. ALTERNATIVE EXECUTION.

This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. It is not necessary that any party sign the same copy of this Agreement as any other Party. All signed copies shall be considered executions of this Agreement. In the event of a dispute regarding authenticity or execution of this Agreement, the burden of proof shall lie with the asserting party.

26. INTERPRETATION AND APPLICATION.

In the event of any dispute arising out of this agreement, the parties agree to seek resolution through good faith negotiations before resorting to legal action. The interpretation of this agreement shall be made in favor of the least restrictive reading possible for the party responsible for compliance, unless such interpretation would materially alter the intent or purpose of this agreement. In case of ambiguity, the party not responsible for compliance shall have the benefit of the doubt. This clause is intended to facilitate and expedite the resolution of disputes, rather than to impede or complicate them.

original: Any dispute or difference between the parties hereto arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be settled by arbitration in accordance with the Commercial Rules of the American Arbitration Association by a panel of three qualified arbitrators. Berkshire and Auriemma shall each choose an arbitrator and the two (2) arbitrators so chosen shall choose the third. If either BERKSHIRE or Auriemma fails to choose an arbitrator within 30 days after notice of commencement of arbitration or if the two arbitrators fail to choose a third arbitrator within thirty (30) days after their appointment, the American Arbitration Association shall, upon the request of any party to the dispute or difference, appoint the arbitrator or arbitrators to constitute or complete the panel as the case may be. Arbitration proceedings hereunder may be initiated by either BERKSHIRE or Auriemma making a written request to the American Arbitration Association, together with any appropriate filing fee, at the office of the American Arbitration Association in the county in which proceedings are to be held pursuant to the terms of the following sentence. All arbitration proceedings or litigation (to the extent the remedy requested is not, by law, available through arbitration [e.g., injunctive relief]) relating to any claims or disputes arising under or relating to this Agreement shall be brought in the county in which the principal executive office of the party not initiating such action or proceeding defendant or responding party) is located. The parties irrevocably submit and consent to the exercise of subject matter jurisdiction and personal jurisdiction over each of the parties by the federal and/or state courts in such jurisdiction (the “Selected Jurisdiction ”). The parties hereby irrevocably waive any and all objections that any party Source: BERKSHIRE HILLS BANCORP INC, 10-Q, 8/9/2012 may now or hereafter have to the exercise of personal and subject matter jurisdiction in the Selected Jurisdiction and to the laying of venue of any such proceeding or action brought in the Selected Jurisdiction. Any order or determination of the arbitral tribunal upon the parties to the arbitration and may be entered in any court having jurisdiction.
modified:
In the event that any disagreement or controversy among the parties concerning this Agreement emerges, the resolution shall be facilitated through mediation instead of arbitration, as per the Mediation Rules of the American Arbitration Association (AAA) by a panel consisting of three impartial mediators. Initially, Berkshire and Auriemma will each designate their respective mediator, and these two mediators will jointly select the third mediator. In the event that either Berkshire or Auriemma fails to nominate a mediator within 30 days after being notified of the initiation of mediation proceedings, or if the two designated mediators fail to agree on the selection of the third mediator within thirty (30) days following their appointment, the AAA will appoint the mediator(s) as necessary. The mediation process may be initiated by either Berkshire or Auriemma submitting a written request to the AAA along with any appropriate fee at the specified AAA office in the county where the proceedings are to take place according to this Agreement's terms.

Any disputes or claims arising from or connected to this Agreement that cannot be resolved through mediation will be brought before the courts of law, specifically those located in the county where Berkshire Hills Bancorp Inc., or Auriemma (the party not initiating the legal action), has its principal executive office. The parties unequivocally surrender and waive any objections to the jurisdiction of federal or state courts within the designated jurisdiction, including personal and subject matter jurisdiction. This waiver applies to any potential objections that either party may currently hold or might assert in the future.

Any mediation decisions rendered among the parties can be filed in a court having jurisdiction. It is important to note that only remedies not available through mediation by law, such as injunctive relief, will be pursued through litigation within the designated jurisdiction. The selected jurisdiction shall have exclusive jurisdiction over all disputes or claims arising under or relating to this Agreement.

1. Berkshire and its Affiliates may choose to have Auriemma as their representative, if desired. However, Berkshire assumes no obligation to seek Auriemma's approval before utilizing another spokesperson in any situation or capacity.

original: 3. Auriemma will participate in one (1) production session annually during the Services Period of not more than three (3) hours, not including travel time, to record a television advertising spot at a date and location to be mutually agreed upon;
ollama_generated: 3. The obligation for Auriemma to partake in an annual production session during the Services Period is limited to one such session per year, lasting no longer than three (3) hours excluding travel time. The specific date and location for this session shall be jointly determined by both parties; however, any subsequent modifications to the agreed-upon arrangements shall be subject to Auriemma's prior written approval, except in cases where additional travel time is required. In such instances, Auriemma will make a good faith effort to accommodate changes, but any resulting inconvenience or additional costs shall not be deemed as breach of this agreement.
